response.message: The name's Dumke, Ben Dumke. Double-o double-o 7.

congratulations to Ben. It was a great pleasure for me working together with him for more than a year. He did a great job.

Barbara Schreiter
Congratulations on taking the distributed teleworking team to the next level!
Cheers!
Congrats boys.
Good show, nice to see you keeping it in the family.
Ben's community overlap charts are super awesome as well:  http://meta.stackoverflow.com/questions/36590/sizes-and-overlaps-of-communities-on-the-sites

When Jeff said he wasn't quite done adding team members yet, what he meant to say was that he requires a unicorn mounted courier to facilitate communication between team members.

Happy to fill the position.

I don't really know much about Ben, but having followed Marc's SOFU contributions and his blog, this is a top choice.

Anyway congrats to both of you lads.

Just out of interest, are these full time positions?

Congrats to both of you!

Cool for Ben to get the 007 ID ;)

Anyway, Jeff, why do you use five digits ids? Are you planning to max out at 99,999 employees? :P

bu-bu-but your names don't start with \J...\ :)

grats guys!
Hope you add some Canadian members next.  They're extremely smart and nice eh? :)
Congratulations, Marc! This is absolutely fantastic news, man. I grow more and more excited with the development of StackOverflow each and every day. Keep up the tremendous work, guys.

Thanks all for the good wishes. @Jin - I know, I know; maybe I'll get it legally changed. @Kev - yes; SO is now 	he job, not *just* a hobby. It will make it hard to know quite were work finished and play-time begins, but I'm sure I'll figure it out.

I love my Unicon.

W
UK represent, Marc!
Congratulations, both of ya! Two very fine people and great additions to any team. May we ask what, except for developing the Unicorn farm for the 21st century, will you be doing at SO?

Thanks everyone!

Yes, it's awesome to become part of this (almost as awesome as the number I received).

Pekka: Well, of course (...let me look this up... ah, here it is) we'll be making the Internet a better place to get expert answers to your questions :)

Captcha: the crewe
Congratulations on the new job, Marc!

It is a great move. Stackoverflow is a community and is always around no matter which ever part of the world you are in (provided a good internet connection). But there is more to it now. I feel more into it when I imagine attending a meeting or conference where Marc Gravel will be addressing and He will be in my reach for face to face interaction in UK.
Congratulations #00006 Marc Gravell and #00007 Ben Dumke. All the best for your Future.
